intro: Matricaria frutescens, commonly known as chamomile, is a flowering plant in the sunflower family. It is native to Europe, western Asia, and North Africa, and is characterized by its daisy-like yellow flowers with white petals. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and has finely divided, fern-like leaves. Chamomile is widely cultivated for its aromatic properties and is used in herbal medicine and teas. Its essential oils, extracted from the flowers, contain compounds like bisabolol and chamazulene, which contribute to its calming and anti-inflammatory effects.
